info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:36PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Big Horn County through 415 PM MDT... At 336 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Smith, or 30 miles south of Hardin, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crow Agency, Fort Smith, St. Xavier and Crow Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for south central Montana.
